headline: Media Industry Don Lemon Apologizes Saying Women Nikki Haley S Age Not Their Prime
summary: CNN (Left bias)host Don Lemon apologized for saying Thursday morning that women over 50, likeRepublican 2024 presidential candidate Nikki Haley, were not in their “prime.”What Lemon Said:Responding to Haley’s calls for “mental competency tests” for older politicians, Lemon said, “This whole talk about age makes me uncomfortable. I think it’s the wrong road to go down. She says people, you know, politicians or something are not in their prime. Nikki Haley isn’t in her prime. Sorry. A woman is considered to be in their prime in 20s and 30s and maybe 40s.” When CNN This Morning co-host Poppy Harlow pushed back, Lemon deferred to Google, adding, “I’m not saying I agree with that.”The Response:Lemon’s remarks were widely criticized. In a fundraising email, Haley wrote, “BTW it’s always the liberals who are the most sexist.” CNN chairman Chris Licht reportedly called Lemon’s words “upsetting, unacceptable, and unfair to his co-hosts” in a Friday morning editorial call. Some reportedly called for CNN to fire Lemon.Lemon’s Apology:In a Thursday afternoontweet, the CNN host wrote that he regretted the remarks, which he said were “inartful and irrelevant,” adding, “A woman’s age doesn't define her either personally or professionally.”For Context:This is not Lemon’s first controversy since losing his prime-time slot at CNN. In December, he reportedly screamed at a co-host off-camera and drew criticism for arguing that the U.S. men’ssoccerteam deserved more pay than the women’s team.How the Media Covered It:Coverage was widespread across the spectrum, sometimes including direct criticism from media figures.
